title: Semantic Kernel Variable Function Call Issue
details:
✅ RESOLVED: Semantic Kernel Variable Function Call Issue

ISSUE: Semantic Kernel was trying to call 'onedrivePath' as a function instead of treating it as a variable, despite prompt templates using correct {{$onedrivePath}} syntax.

ERROR DETAILS (RESOLVED):
- Function .onedrivePath execution failed with error: The plugin collection does not contain a plugin and/or function with the specified names. Plugin name - '', function name - 'onedrivePath'.
- This occurred during chunk summarization in video-notes processing

ROOT CAUSE IDENTIFIED:
The issue was in PromptTemplateService.cs default templates that used old syntax when template files couldn't be loaded:

```csharp
// BEFORE (INCORRECT):
DefaultChunkPrompt = "... {{onedrive-path}} ... {{course}} ... {{content}}";

// AFTER (CORRECT):  
DefaultChunkPrompt = "... {{$onedrivePath}} ... {{$course}} ... {{$content}}";
```

SOLUTION IMPLEMENTED:
1. Updated PromptTemplateService.cs DefaultChunkPrompt and DefaultFinalPrompt to use correct Semantic Kernel syntax
2. Changed {{onedrive-path}} → {{$onedrivePath}}
3. Changed {{course}} → {{$course}}  
4. Changed {{content}} → {{$content}}
5. Added {{$input}} to DefaultFinalPrompt

VERIFICATION:
✅ Successfully tested with video-notes processing - no more Semantic Kernel errors
✅ Completed video processing without any function call issues
✅ Templates now load correctly and variables are processed as expected

STATUS: COMPLETELY RESOLVED - The CLI now processes video files without any Semantic Kernel variable/function errors.
